title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

metadata.background_info:
Scotland is one of the UK’s four constituent nations - and its politics are currently dominated by the [Scottish National Party](https://whatscotlandthinks.org/), a party whose core aim is to remove Scotland from the UK and become an independent country. 

The SNP government in Edinburgh previously successfully negotiated with the UK-wide government for the right to hold a referendum, [which took place in 2014](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_Scottish_independence_referendum). The “No” side (“Better Together”) won 55% to 45%. The SNP has, however, won every Scottish national election since that date.

The SNP wish to have a fresh vote - stating that Brexit has changed the terms of the argument. The UK government has, to date, refused to countenance permitting such a vote. Under the Scotland Act, the Edinburgh government does not have the power to hold one [without permission.](https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1998/46/section/30)

title: Will Bing's search engine market share be at least 5% in March of 2024?
body: This question resolves as **Yes** if Bing's market share for the month of March 2024 is 5% or higher [according to Statcounter](https://gs.statcounter.com/search-engine-market-share), using the first value accessed by Metaculus on or after April 15, 2024.

metadata.background_info: Microsoft's search engine, [Bing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microsoft_Bing), was the second most popular search engine after Google in December of 2022, according to [data provided by Statcounter](https://gs.statcounter.com/search-engine-market-share). Statcounter reports a market share of 92.58% for Google and 3.03% for Bing in December of 2022. In early January 2023 it was [reported](https://www.engadget.com/microsoft-reportedly-integrating-chatgpt-technology-into-bing-131502579.html) that Microsoft was exploring integration of OpenAI's [ChatGPT](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ChatGPT) into Bing search results.

title: Will the Democratic Progressive Party (DPP) win the 2024 presidential election in Taiwan?
body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the DPP candidate is inaugurated on 20 May 2024 (or, in the case of a delayed inauguration, is announced to have won by [BBC](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-51077553) and [New York Times](https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=2ahUKEwiRva34lOn8AhWYM1kFHXzCDacQFnoECBAQAQ&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2F2020%2F01%2F11%2Fworld%2Fasia%2Ftaiwan-election-china.html&usg=AOvVaw0DGpxtWlE6BHtzJzB97RTp)). Otherwise, including the event of a premature Chinese invasion and a toppling of the government (making an election impossible) it resolves as **No**

metadata.background_info: [The 16th President and Vice President election of the Republic of China is scheduled to be held in Taiwan in early 2024](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Taiwanese_presidential_election). Incumbent President [Tsai Ing-wen](https://english.president.gov.tw/Page/40) of the Democratic Progressive Party (DPP), who was reelected in 2020, is ineligible to seek a third term. The [winner of the 2024 presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Taiwanese_presidential_election) is scheduled to be inaugurated on 20 May 2024.

title: Will a nuclear weapon be detonated in or above a European Union state before the following dates? (March 15, 2024)
body: This question will resolve **Yes** if a nuclear weapon is detonated in or above the territory of a European Union (EU) member state before the dates indicated.  A [deliberate, inadvertent, or accidental/unauthorised](http://scienceandglobalsecurity.org/archive/sgs21barrett.pdf) detonation would result in the question resolving as **Yes**.

metadata.background_info:
The European Union comprises [27 member countries](https://european-union.europa.eu/principles-countries-history/country-profiles_en), some of which possess nuclear weapons or are under the protection of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) nuclear umbrella. France and the United Kingdom are recognized nuclear-weapon states under the [Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons (NPT)](https://www.un.org/disarmament/wmd/nuclear/npt/). The NPT, which entered into force in 1970, serves as the cornerstone of global nuclear non-proliferation efforts, aiming to prevent the spread of nuclear weapons, promote the peaceful use of nuclear energy, and facilitate disarmament.

The geopolitical landscape in and around Europe has seen significant changes over the past several decades, with the collapse of the Soviet Union in 1991 and the subsequent enlargement of the EU and NATO. These developments have altered the balance of power in the region and generated new security challenges. The resurgence of great power competition, Russia's invasion of Ukraine, and the proliferation of nuclear technology to non-state actors are factors that have contributed to concerns about the likelihood of a nuclear detonation in EU territory.

title: Will the Sacramento Kings advance to the second round of the NBA playoffs in 2024?
body: The question will resolve **Yes** if the Sacramento Kings reach the Conference Semifinals of the NBA playoffs for the 2023-2024 NBA season.

metadata.background_info: The Sacremento Kings were one of the [surprises](https://www.skysports.com/nba/news/12028/12904737/2022-23-nba-season-review-the-good-the-bad-and-the-ugly) of the 2022-23 NBA season, reaching the playoffs for the first time since 2006. Their head coach, Mike Brown, was the first coach in NBA history to [unanimously be named](https://www.sacbee.com/sports/nba/sacramento-kings/article274474515.html) Coach of the Year.

title: Will Erling Haaland score the most goals in the 2023/24 Premier League season?
body: The question resolves **Yes** if Erling Haaland is the player with the largest number of goals after each of the 20 PL teams plays their 38th game of the 2023/24 season, [according to Oracle Cloud via the PL website](https://www.premierleague.com/stats/top/players/goals?se=578)

metadata.background_info: Erling Haaland plays for Manchester City, a football team which competes in a number of competitions, including the Premier League.

title: Will the Pandemic and All Hazards Preparedness Act (PAHPA) be reauthorized for more than 4 years before April 1st, 2024, and December 31st, 2024? (2024 April 1)
body: This question will resolve to ”Yes” if, before the listed date, a bill has been signed into law by the President which extends key provisions of the Pandemic and All Hazards Preparedness Act (PAHPA) to at least fiscal year 2027. Resolution will be determined according to reporting from credible sources or from the text of the bill as needed.

metadata.background_info:
According to [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pandemic_and_All-Hazards_Preparedness_Act), the purpose of the Pandemic and All-Hazards Preparedness Act (PAHPA) (signed into law in 2006) is "to improve the Nation's public health and medical preparedness and response capabilities for emergencies, whether deliberate, accidental, or natural." Like many laws that authorize activities for federal agencies, PAHPA must be reauthorized by its expiration date in order for the law to continue taking effect.

The law was reauthorized by Congress in 2013 and again in June 2019.

The current bill expired on September 30th, 2023.

These two dates are chosen as follows:

- April 1st, 2024 is a suggested date after which most energy is focused on elections

- December 31st, 2024 is within the current congressional session (118th Congress)

title: Which 8 players will participate in the 2024 FIDE Candidates tournament? (Magnus Carlsen)
body: The question will resolve based on the list of 8 players participating in the 2024 Candidates tournament, according to [FIDE.com](https://wcc.fide.com) and on the official (yet to be launched) tournament website at the start of the 1st game of the tournament.

metadata.background_info:
The [FIDE Candidates Tournament](https://wcc.fide.com) is an 8-player, double round-robin, classical chess tournament. Usually occurring every 2 years, the winner of the FIDE Candidates Tournament wins the right to challenge the reigning FIDE Chess World Champion for the title the following year.  The 2024 Candidates Tournament will happen in Toronto, Canada, from 3rd-25th April 2024. The winner of the 2024 Candidates will be able to challenge Ding Liren for the World Championship, which usually happens ~November later that year. 

[The 8 spots are allocated in the following way](https://handbook.fide.com/files/handbook/FIDE_Candidates_Tournament_2024_Qualification_Paths.pdf): 

- 1 Spot goes to the runner-up of the last world championship (Ian Nepomniachtchi) 
 - 3 Spots go to the top 3 placed finishers at the 2023 FIDE World Cup (Magnus Carlsen, Praggnanandhaa Rameshbabu, Fabiano Caruana)
- 2 Spots for the first and second place finishers at the [2023 FIDE Grande Swiss] (https://grandswiss.fide.com) tournament. If either of the top 2 placed finishers have already qualified through the two proceeding paths, the next highest-placed finisher at the Grand Swiss will qualify instead.
- 1 Spot goes to the highest place finisher of the [2023-2024 FIDE Circuit](https://wcc.fide.com/fide_circuit.phtml) who hasn't already qualified through the proceedings paths (i.e. even though Fabiano Caruana is guaranteed to finish first in the circuit, he qualified through the World Cup path, and so the second place player from the circuit will likely qualify instead, unless the happen to finish in the top 2 of the Grande Swiss). 
- 1 Spot to the top rated player in the [FIDE rankings](https://ratings.fide.com/top_lists.phtml?list=open) who hasn't qualified through any of the other paths, provided the player has played at least 4 classical time control tournaments eligible for the 2023 FIDE Circuit.

- 2 Spots for the first and second place finishers at the [2023 FIDE Grande Swiss] (https://grandswiss.fide.com) tournament. If either of the top 2 placed finishers have already qualified through the two proceeding paths, the next highest-placed finisher at the Grand Swiss will qualify instead.
- 1 Spot goes to the highest place finisher of the [2023-2024 FIDE Circuit](https://wcc.fide.com/fide_circuit.phtml) who hasn't already qualified through the proceedings paths (i.e. even though Fabiano Caruana is guaranteed to finish first in the circuit, he qualified through the World Cup path, and so the second place player from the circuit will likely qualify instead, unless the happen to finish in the top 2 of the Grande Swiss). 
- 1 Spot to the top rated player in the [FIDE rankings](https://ratings.fide.com/top_lists.phtml?list=open) who hasn't qualified through any of the other paths, provided the player has played at least 4 classical time control tournaments eligible for the 2023 FIDE Circuit.

title: Which 8 players will participate in the 2024 FIDE Candidates tournament? (Vishwanathan Anand)
body: The question will resolve based on the list of 8 players participating in the 2024 Candidates tournament, according to [FIDE.com](https://wcc.fide.com) and on the official (yet to be launched) tournament website at the start of the 1st game of the tournament.

metadata.background_info:
The [FIDE Candidates Tournament](https://wcc.fide.com) is an 8-player, double round-robin, classical chess tournament. Usually occurring every 2 years, the winner of the FIDE Candidates Tournament wins the right to challenge the reigning FIDE Chess World Champion for the title the following year.  The 2024 Candidates Tournament will happen in Toronto, Canada, from 3rd-25th April 2024. The winner of the 2024 Candidates will be able to challenge Ding Liren for the World Championship, which usually happens ~November later that year. 

[The 8 spots are allocated in the following way](https://handbook.fide.com/files/handbook/FIDE_Candidates_Tournament_2024_Qualification_Paths.pdf): 

- 1 Spot goes to the runner-up of the last world championship (Ian Nepomniachtchi) 
 - 3 Spots go to the top 3 placed finishers at the 2023 FIDE World Cup (Magnus Carlsen, Praggnanandhaa Rameshbabu, Fabiano Caruana)
- 2 Spots for the first and second place finishers at the [2023 FIDE Grande Swiss] (https://grandswiss.fide.com) tournament. If either of the top 2 placed finishers have already qualified through the two proceeding paths, the next highest-placed finisher at the Grand Swiss will qualify instead.
- 1 Spot goes to the highest place finisher of the [2023-2024 FIDE Circuit](https://wcc.fide.com/fide_circuit.phtml) who hasn't already qualified through the proceedings paths (i.e. even though Fabiano Caruana is guaranteed to finish first in the circuit, he qualified through the World Cup path, and so the second place player from the circuit will likely qualify instead, unless the happen to finish in the top 2 of the Grande Swiss). 
- 1 Spot to the top rated player in the [FIDE rankings](https://ratings.fide.com/top_lists.phtml?list=open) who hasn't qualified through any of the other paths, provided the player has played at least 4 classical time control tournaments eligible for the 2023 FIDE Circuit.

body: The question will resolve based on the list of 8 players participating in the 2024 Candidates tournament, according to [FIDE.com](https://wcc.fide.com) and on the official (yet to be launched) tournament website at the start of the 1st game of the tournament.
